_note: RESEARCH TOOL — not production orchestration. Synthetic data for Papers 9/25 Figure 2.
_figure: Fig 2 — Deadlock Freedom: standard vs broken composition

standard_composition.narrative: The standard three-protocol composition is deadlock-free within the bounded reachable state space. From the initial joint state (ATP=low, ASP=normal, AEAP=available), the actions 'read' and 'write' are globally permitted, guaranteeing progress.

broken_composition.narrative: The BROKEN protocol denies all actions from its single 'sink' state. The initial joint state (ATP=low, BROKEN=sink) is immediately a deadlock: every action in the union alphabet is blocked by BROKEN. The verifier correctly identifies this at state index 0.

ATP_ASP_AEAP.description: BFS from (low, normal, available). Only read/write advance state in initial configuration.
